intro: Arabis planisiliqua subsp. nemorensis, commonly known as the Forest Arabis, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with small white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for ecological restoration projects in wetland and woodland habitats.
